name: Fitzpatrick Manhattan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights at The Fitzpatrick Manhattan, leaving the day before the American Thanksgiving holiday. Rates, service, and location all excellent. Housekeeping was terrific! A perfect, quiet room that had room enough for a desk, but was still intimate. Recommended by friends who travel to New York frequently, and I have recommened to friends headed to New York. Everything done right!
reviews.title: Just Lovely

reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights over the New Year and had the best time ever. Our experience started before we even got there when we were upgraded from a room to a suite at no extra cost! The location is perfect with a lot of destinations within a few minutes walk and the rest only a short taxi ride or subway trip away. The quality of the rooms were excellent, very clean and freshly decorated. The staff couldn't have been more friendly, offering excellent local advice on everything which saved us hours of searching and, not to say, hundreds of dollars. The bar was nice and cosy and the food was good, for the few occasions we ate in. I would really have to be very picky if I was to find anything negative to say so I wont! If we ever return to New York Fitzpatrick's will be our destination.
reviews.title: Recommend highly

reviews.text: Just returned from a five night stay at The Fitzpatrick Manhattan and my daughter and I really enjoyed our stay. By New York standards this a a small boutique Hotel. You may ask why an Irishman would choose an Irish owned Hotel in a city with so much choice but while obviously proud of its "Irishness" it is not Overdone. The location of the Hotel is perfect for Shopping (5th Ave),Central Park and many other of The Midtown attractions all within walking distance. Our room (1206) was a little small by european standards but big by New York standards it served our needs perfectly. No bath but a lovely spacious shower. The sounds of the City could be heard at night but did not affect my sleep and only added to the NYC experience. The room was spotless and the Housekeeping Staff were great letting you have a Sleep In if you wanted.Saying that that is the Biggest strength of this Hotel. THE STAFF ARE FANTASTIC EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM ARE TEN OUT OF TEN.Special mention to Ciarian, Chris, Aoife,Christina, Anna, Christian,Brian and Peter but in truth the were all Excellent . Nothing was too much trouble from Service with a smile to friendly Conversation to advice on the City to Booking attractions. Well done Mr Fitz your staff do your lovely hotel proud.his will be my Haven for any future trips to NYC. The Fitz Bar was Quiet while we were there but always friendly and the Food was good
reviews.title: An Oasis of friendly Calm
Amazing service
reviews.text: Stayed here for New Year and was very happy with the hotel.
Slight issue with the booking but we were given drinks while the problem was resolved and were upgraded to a beautiful room thanks to Kris.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I stayed at the Fitzpatrick for the first time in September 2010.We enjoyed it so much that we stayed again for Christmas 2012, which exceeded our high expectation once again, causing us to plan to stay here in all future visits to New York City. Our most recent stay for Christmas 2012 also included our 10th anniversary.
reviews.title: Impeccable Service

reviews.text: The service provided by the full team was impeccable. They were polite, friendly, and inviting well beyond service industry standards, and constantly offered amenities to make our stay more enjoyable. Because our room wasn’t ready when we checked in, we were upgraded to a suite with a Lexington view. As well, when the Assistant Manager learned that we were staying at the hotel for our 10th anniversary he sent us a bottle of champagne and a card congratulating us.
reviews.title: Great location. Very friendly staff. Good place for a family.

reviews.text: Logistically speaking, both times we have stayed here our rooms have been large (for NYC standards) with comfortable beds and well priced (again, for NYC standards). The location (57th & Lexington) is conveniently close to a subway station with access to the R, N, Q, 4, 5, 6 trains.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel. Good sized rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I have stayed in several hotels in New Jersey, Brooklyn, and Manhattan and enjoy staying at the Fitzpatrick the most. We plan to stay here going forward for all of our future trips to NY and I have, and would recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates good service and good value.
reviews.title: Amazing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fitzpatrick Manhattan over Christmas. We were delighted with our one-bedroom suite with 2 double beds in the bedroom and a pull-out sofa in the other room. (It's hard to find such spaces for reasonable prices in Manhattan.) The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and gracious. Great mid-town location.
reviews.title: No Free WiFi :- (

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chris, I can't say enough about this hotel. Wonderfully welcoming and helpful staff. Upgraded to suite upon arrival with complimentary champagne. Beautiful food. Lively bar. Nothing is too much to ask for in this hotel. Every staff memeber was so friendly and helpful with any question regarding bookings, advice for restaurants, directions, dietary requirement specifics. Just perfect. Thanks for making this holiday one to remember. I will definitely book this hotel again, definitely.
reviews.title: Extremely friendly & helpful staff

reviews.text: Upon check in, we were upgraded to a Presidential Suite!! What a beautiful room. Fresh fruit and bottled sparkling water awaited us. Huge room for NYC standards and bathroom was so beautiful and clean. Excellent shower pressure and hot. Beds were very comfortable and even had evening turndown service that made up the sofa bed for my son. Room also had wet bar and multiple spacious closets. Would definately stay here again. Will not dissapoint!
reviews.title: So Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For an Irish traveller, or for anyone else, Fitzpatricks is a great choice. There is a genuine Irish feel to the hotel and the management are excellent. The location is great and within minutes of downtown Manhattan. The standard rooms are small, but no smaller than a standard room in any big city. The lobby and bar are smaller than most hotels, but sufficient. For a foreigner going to New York, you wont go wrong with Fitzpatricks.
reviews.title: great choice in Manhattan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fitzpatrick over Thanksgiving and truly enjoyed our visit. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the room was comfortably furnished. Although the hotel is older, the decor and bathrooms are very modern and stylish.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay except for one thing

reviews.text: The only reason I would think twice about staying here or suggesting it to a friend was the temperature. As an older hotel, only the heater is available during the winter. The common areas (hallways etc) are kept very very warm, so even though the system was off in our room, it was still so hot it was hard for us to sleep. We had the windows open but couldn't get a breeze. Some people would probably really like the temperature, but if you prefer a cooler room you may want to look somewhere else during the winter.
reviews.title: A Classy Hotel

reviews.text: We had the good fortune of staying at the Fitzpatrick during Hurricane Sandy last month. We had originally booked to stay there for a long weekend but thanks to Sandy ended up by staying for more than a week. For the whole of our stay the staff and management where fantastic. They were totally flexible when it came to dealing with the uncertainties of flight changes, and were courteous and helpful from start to finish. When (and not if) we go back to New York the Fitzpatrick will be high on our list of hotel destinations.
reviews.title: There are few hotels like it

reviews.text: I stayed here for for the first time one night at the end of September mainly because of its convenient location in midtown. I traveled with my brother from New Jersey so we could attend a wedding party at a venue nearby and I must say I was impressed with the hotel and the way they treat their guests. The gentleman Kris who checked me in was extremely kind and made me feel so welcomed. Peter the bellman in the morning helped me book a restaurant, book a dinner cruise on the hudson, sent me to a great comedy club in the village and helped me with pretty much anything I could ask for, special thanks to him he made this trip. Its a great feeling when you get the sense everyone you talk to there actually enjoys what they do and they do it very well to say the least. Ive stayed at many big hotels that offer nowhere near the amount of service that this small boutique does. Only downside was no free wi-fi but it makes up for it in every other aspect. The room itself was nice with comfortable beds, great robes and very clean. The restaurant is also nice and thanks to the bartender Jessica who was great fun to talk with. I would absolutely recommend this place for those traveling with couples or families because it is a quiet almost hidden location but super convenient to everything around.
reviews.title: The staff makes this place!

reviews.text: -Michael
reviews.title: Beware! Booking on the Fitzpatrick Hotel site is not what it seems

reviews.text: If you book on the Fitzpatrick Hotel site, you are actually making a pay-in-advance, very difficult to cancel reservation on an offshore site called Easy to Book. At the Fitzpatrick, your reservation will be listed as having been made through Expedia, but it doesn't end there. You can't cancel with Expedia. The reservation lives on Easy to book. Never heard of this? Neither had I. Took two hours and many, many phone calls to resolve. Not recommended.
reviews.title: TOTALLY BRILLIANT ON EVERY LEVEL

reviews.text: We travelled to New York on the 26th October 2012 as a party of four adults. We stayed at the Fitzpatrick Hotel and can honestly say we all absolutely loved this hotel. The rooms had everything required and the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. As you can see from our arrival date we were in New York for the hurricane, however luckily for us this did not affect our stay except for a couple of days less shopping. The staff in the hotel had to stay in the hotel because of the weather and they worked their socks off to make sure all our needs were catered for. I have stayed in some amazing hotels but this was just something else. The atmosphere and staff made it exceptional - Mark, Chris, Aoife, Hasan, Ciaran, Cormac, Anna, Jules and all the staff who's names I didn't get YOU WERE ALL SUPERB. Thank you so much, best wishes to you all and we hope to return to New York and The Fitzpatricks Hotel in the near future!!!!
reviews.title: Central hotel in Manhattan.

aka: Fitzpatrick Manhattan Hotel New York City
description: European-style Boutique hotel with Irish hospitality, at 57th St - Rooms with beamed ceilings, brass fixtures, rosewood furniture.
